instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> enter key not working
threads.message:
Have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that is in perfect condition with no liquid damage. All keys on the keyboard work but the enter key. Already replaced keyboard but same issue is still present.

What should I check next??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> enter key not working
threads.message: Check all traces from keyboard connector could be a busted one. I'd try multiple keyboards to be sure. Also could be an issue with <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> enter key not working
threads.message:
Are you sure "Enter" is the only non-working key?
Individual key fault is sign of bad keyboard.
MLB issue can generate problems with one entire raw, or column for keyboard matrix.

Open Notes and test each key...
